intro: Crotalaria ovalis, commonly known as the oval false falsepea, is a flowering plant native to tropical and subtropical regions. It belongs to the family Fabaceae, which includes legumes, and is characterized by its distinctive yellow flowers. The plant has palmately lobed leaves and produces pods that contain seeds. Crotalaria ovalis is often found in disturbed soils and can thrive in a variety of environmental conditions. It is also noted for its potential use in phytoremediation due to its ability to accumulate heavy metals.
